A very fine and hip tapas bar/cafe in L'Eixample.  This restaurant was a very quick walk from our boutique hotel on Calvet.  The colorful Eames chairs with Eiffel Tower bases, chic and modern interior, and people-watching alfresco cafe, all on a fashionable corner was a no-brainer for us.  As it turned out, the food, too, was fresh and flavorful.  (Grilled octopus was outstanding!)  Waiter on the first visit was super friendly and attentive.  (Return visit:  Well, waitress was slow and not particularly attentive.)  I'd give the food 4-stars.  Service, 3-stars.  Split the difference for a 3-1/2 star overall rating.
